actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase to $3,000 the amount of outside earnings permitted each year without deductions from benefits thereunder and to reduce from 72 to 70 the age at which these deductions will cease to be made from benefits based on such individual's wage records.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Increases to $3,000 the amount of outside earnings permitted each year without deductions from benefits under the Federal Old Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance program of the Social Security Act. Reduces from 72 to 70 the age at which these deductions will cease to be made from benefits based on such individual's wage record.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase to $3,000 the amount of outside earnings permitted each year without deductions from benefits thereunder and to reduce from 72 to 70 the age at which these deductions will cease to be made from benefits based on such individual's wage records.
